page.title: 17Geography-N.Wingfield
page.content: The{landscape}of the area is undulating,sloping from 168m.a.s.l.to 217m.a.s.l.The{drainage}is north-westward;there are streams forming the headwaters of R.Rother.The {farmland}is mixed arable and { } pastoral;main arable crops-wheat&rape seed.Coal{mining}in the past has affected the environment-opencast workings (Danesmoor)&reclaimed pit tips(Holmewood).There are two{disused} {mineral railways(north to south).}Most {industry}is now light except for an iron foundry.{N.Wingfield}and{ {Holmewood}are the largest villages-developed along the main road A6175.The main road links Matlock / Clay Cross with the{M1 motorway}and Mansfield.There is also a{main line {railway}between Sheffield,Nottingham and London.No natural vegetation-a few areas of{planted oak}and{conifer trees
